structured_data.professional_summary: Cybersecurity professional with experience in penetration testing, vulnerability assessment and risk management. Strong military background provides a unique perspective on layered defense and how to get around them. Proven track record in leading technical projects, troubleshooting complex issues, and communicating technical issues.

experience.responsibilities: Volunteer position where I created CTFs and labs using Virtual Machines to help my fellow Cyber Security students hone their Offensive Security skills

experience.job_title: Senior Staff Officer – Simulation and Modelling
experience.responsibilities: Responsible for Simulation & Modelling for the Royal Canadian Navy (RCN). Managed the upgrade project of a classified network worth $40 million, resulting in net progress towards modernizing the RCN.

Provided oversight for the trades training of all Weapons Engineering Technician and Combat Systems Engineering Officers of the East Coast fleet. Provided mentoring, supervision and coaching of 40 staff, leading to a successful throughput of approximately 120 students per year.

Responsible for military HR, IT, and security of a 1000 person unit focused on ship repair and maintenance. Managed a team of 7 personnel (military and civilian), ensuring that operational risks were managed adequately and maintenance of the ships proceeded smoothly.

Responsible for the Security, IT, Scheduling, Purchasing, Safety & Environment, and Equipment Maintenance of the school. Supervised 8 section heads and managed 60 personnel to ensure that training was continuous for approximately 600 students per year going through trades training. Risk managed any potential disruption to training to keep down-time to a minimum.

Responsible for the maintenance and mission readiness of all Combat Systems aboard HMCS Ville de Quebec. Managed a department of 60 technicians to ensure that all required systems were maintained and managed risk to minimize equipment down-time, resulting in a successful counter-drug patrol in the Caribbean Basin.

experience.job_title: Staff Officer (Minor Warships and Auxiliary Vessels)
experience.responsibilities: Responsible for equipment upgrade projects and maintenance pertaining to Minor War Vessels of the RCN. Managed multi-million dollar upgrade projects, resulting in a satellite communication upgrade for the KINGSTON class Maritime Coastal Defense Vessels.

Trained to act as Head of Combat Systems Engineering Department aboard HALIFAX class Frigates, Unit Radiation Safety Officer, Unit General Safety Officer, Unit Demolitions Officer, Unit Ammunition Officer and Unit Laser Safety Officer. Accumulated 300 sea days deploying to the Gulf of Aden and the Arctic Ocean.

volunteer_experience.description: Created CTFs and labs using Virtual Machines to help Cyber Security students hone Offensive Security skills

years_exp: 22 years of experience in Leadership and Technical Project Management
profile:
Philippe Nault is a highly skilled cybersecurity professional with a robust background in penetration testing, vulnerability assessment, and risk management. A graduate of the Royal Military College of Canada with a B.Eng. in Chemical & Materials Engineering, Philippe is currently pursuing a Cyber Security Diploma at Nova Scotia Community College (NSCC). His extensive military career with the Royal Canadian Navy has honed his expertise in layered defense strategies, project management, and technical problem-solving, giving him a unique edge in the cybersecurity domain. He is also an OffSec Certified Professional (OSCP), demonstrating his technical proficiency and dedication to advancing his offensive security expertise.

With over two decades of leadership experience, Philippe has managed high-stakes technical projects, including overseeing a $40 million classified network upgrade for the Royal Canadian Navy. As a Combat Systems Engineering Officer, he successfully led a team of 60 technicians to ensure mission readiness during a counter-drug patrol in the Caribbean Basin. Currently, Philippe serves as the Head of the Offensive Security Club at NSCC, where he volunteers to design Capture The Flag (CTF) challenges and virtual labs to empower students in mastering offensive security skills. His technical toolkit includes Kali Linux, Nmap, Metasploit, Python, Bash scripting, and a range of tools for vulnerability exploitation, privilege escalation, and Active Directory exploitation.

Philippe's bilingual fluency in French and English, combined with his deep technical acumen, makes him a versatile and impactful professional. Whether managing multi-million-dollar projects, mentoring the next generation of engineers, or delving into the intricacies of cybersecurity, he brings exceptional leadership and technical expertise to every challenge. His ability to bridge military discipline with cutting-edge cybersecurity knowledge positions him as a standout professional ready to tackle complex security challenges in any environment.

responsibilities: Designed Capture The Flag challenges and labs using Virtual Machines to enhance students' offensive security skills effectively.

other_experience.position_title: Senior Staff Officer – Simulation and Modelling
responsibilities: Directed simulation and modelling efforts to support Royal Canadian Navy operations and training initiatives.
Spearheaded a $40 million classified network upgrade project, contributing to the modernization of naval capabilities.
Managed the training programs for Weapons Engineering Technicians and Combat Systems Engineering Officers in the East Coast fleet.
Supervised and mentored a team of 40 staff to achieve successful throughput of 120 students annually.
Oversaw HR, IT, and security operations for a 1,000-person unit specializing in ship repair and maintenance.
Led a team of 7 to successfully mitigate operational risks and ensure smooth ship maintenance activities.
Supervised security, IT, and equipment maintenance to ensure uninterrupted training for approximately 600 students annually.
Managed 8 section heads and 60 personnel, implementing strategies to minimize training disruptions effectively.
Ensured mission readiness of all combat systems aboard HMCS Ville de Quebec while minimizing equipment downtime.
Directed a 60-person department, enabling a successful counter-drug operation in the Caribbean Basin.

other_experience.position_title: Staff Officer (Minor Warships and Auxiliary Vessels)
responsibilities: Led multi-million dollar upgrade projects, including satellite communication enhancements for KINGSTON class vessels.
Coordinated maintenance and equipment upgrade efforts for Minor War Vessels in the Royal Canadian Navy.
Completed training as Head of Combat Systems Engineering for HALIFAX class Frigates, specializing in critical systems.
Certified in safety roles including Radiation Safety Officer and Ammunition Officer, accumulating 300 sea days in deployments.
Designed and created Capture The Flag (CTF) challenges and labs using Virtual Machines.
Supported Cyber Security students in improving their Offensive Security skills.
Led initiatives to foster collaboration and learning within the club.
